settings.tagline: Flexible Opportunities, Positive Teamwork, Great Pay
settings.heading: Tennis Officials
settings.description: Join the UTR Pro Tennis officiating team through working as a chair umpire or referee at pro events throughout the United States. This is your home for viewing upcoming events, easily submitting availability, and accessing important tournament information and communications. UTRDesk.com is the streamlined platform that will be your go-to resource for all UTR Pro Tennis Tour assignments in the U.S. Starting with UTR PTT events in Newport Beach and other Southern California locations and quickly expanding later this summer.

settings.block-list-items: Chair high-level pro tennis while earning competitive pay
Choose from many opportunities every week of the year that fit your schedule and lifestyle
Travel or stay close to home. Your choice!
Gain valuable experience, including using cutting-edge technology, such as ELC, live streaming, coaching and live scoring!
Thrive and connect in our friendly, inclusive, and diverse atmosphere. Whether you are a long-timer or just starting your career, you can make our events home for you.
Rapidly hone your skills by chairing 2-3 highly-competitive matches daily

settings.list4: Team-friendly atmosphere, featuring both veteran chair umpires and those with less experience, to create the opportunity for (What's a good word for knowledge transfer)Continued chair experience by chairing 2-3 matches per day and ability to hone your skills in highly competitive matches

settings.heading: What is UTRDesk.com?
settings.row_content:
UTRDesk.com is your source for UTR Pro Tennis Tour event staffing and scheduling.

UTRDesk.com is where you can go to find events, view your assignments, message our team , and anything and everything else you'll need before, during, and after a tournament.

The tournament staffing and management system is designed by referees, chair umpires, and software engineers to make life easier for you.

Officials, and in the future athletic trainers and volunteers, can sign up and submit availability for any UTR PTT event.

Successful tournaments have happy staff and players. Use UTRDesk.com to save time and stay organized!

settings.heading: How does UTRDesk.com work?
settings.row_content:
Now with UTRDesk.com, chair umpires can easily view their requests and assignments in a centralized place online at any time.

Tennis officials can track their assignments, including dates and times, and update their status for future events (available, confirmed, etc). Officials also can check-in using the system.

To use UTRDesk.com, you just need a laptop, tablet, or iPad with internet access.

UTR PTT will be using UTRDesk.com the following ways:

  • Text notification to officials (note: you must opt-in to receive SMS notifications)
  • UTR can message officials of changes and new schedule releases
  • UTR PTT now will be able to view chair umpire status, including availability, event requests, or what days or times they are scheduled to work.

settings.heading: How much money do UTR PTT officials earn?
settings.row_content: We pay competitively with UTR standard rates. To inquire about specific rates in your region, please email ptt@utrsports.com.

settings.heading: Where can tennis officials work UTR PTT events?
settings.row_content: UTR Pro Tennis Tour features 450+ events across the world. To view the full UTR PTT calendar, click here. View open and future assignments on www.UTRDesk.com.

settings.heading: Once I qualify for the Tour Card, how do I earn incentives?
settings.row_content:
• Play 2 events and get $120 back for Power, which includes access to insights and power perks. PTT exclusive benefits may vary by region and will grow over time. Estimated $500 value.
  • Play four 7-day events and receive a $750 bonus if you are one of the first 100 men and women. Note: 18+ years old to be eligible.
  • Participate in 4 or more events and compete in a $300,000 yearlong points race using your top 8 performances. Participants who finish in the top 100 of the points race can receive a payout of up to $10,000. Note: 18+ years old to be eligible.
  • View and download this simple one-page PDF that breaks down how the $500,000 Tour Card program works.

settings.heading: How are points determined?
settings.row_content:
To maintain consistency, points follow the prize money breakdown. For a 20 and 32 player draw, the 20-player prize money structure will be used for points.

For a 16-player draw, the 16-player prize money structure is used. The 8 best tournament results will count toward race rankings.

settings.heading: What are the 3 tiers of benefits in the PTT Tour Card?
settings.row_content:
In the first tier, upon completing one PTT event, players will receive their Tour Card. Completion of a second event will unlock hundreds of dollars in exclusive PTT benefits, including free UTR Sports apparel and free access to advanced analytics to help players’ games, with additional perks and benefits.

In the second tier, the first 100 adult players from each gender to complete four PTT events will be rewarded $750 in bonus money.

In the third tier, $300,000 will be awarded through the year-long points race. All adult players with a Tour Card are eligible for the race, and the top 100 players in each gender will earn additional money at the end of 2025. First-place finishers will receive $10,000!

settings.heading: Who is eligible to play UTR Pro Tennis Tour and earn the Tour Card (*)?
settings.row_content:
Players must meet target UTR thresholds and be outside the top 200 PTT ranking. Players ranked 1-200 will only be accepted with a wild card approved by UTR.

OPEN COMPETITION: UTR Pro Tennis Tour are open to all tennis players based on merit and without discrimination. Minors under the age of fourteen (14) shall not be eligible for entry.

* TOUR CARD ELIGIBILITY: All PTT Players can earn a Tour Card with exclusive benefits when they play 2 events. To be eligible to receive bonus and points race money, a player must be 18 years or older on or before the first day of the event to count.

settings.heading: What is the UTR Pro Tennis Tour?
settings.row_content: The UTR Pro Tennis Tour (PTT) supports tennis globally with over $11 million a year. The UTR PTT serves players with a UTR ranking 200-2000 in the world and enables more than 450 events globally with better guaranteed prize money and round-robin formats found nowhere else in the globe. In the United States alone, UTR PTT hosts three to four tournaments a week, all year. Join us today!

settings.heading: Why use the 8 best results?
settings.row_content:
Using the 8 best results encourages players to participate in multiple PTT events while ensuring that top performances are rewarded.

NOTE: Players are welcome to play in as many events as you like, but only the 8 best results will count toward your ranking. Players can play more than 8 events in hopes of replacing their lowest result.

settings.heading: Can I play more than 8 events?
Will points I earned before I was 18 years old count retroactively when I am 18?
settings.row_content: No, points can only be earned if you are 18 or older on the event start date. However, events played before turning 18 still count toward meeting the 4-event minimum for the final standings payout.

settings.heading: Can I still participate in PTT events if I’m not 18 yet?
settings.row_content:
Yes, players under 18 are welcome to participate in PTT events, but they will only receive Tier 1 benefits.

To be eligible to receive Tier 2 and Tier 3 benefits, a player must be 18 years old (or older) on or before the first day of the event.

settings.heading: Do these points count towards ATP/WTA points?
settings.row_content: No, the PTT points race is independent of all other tours. Only PTT events counts.

settings.heading: More questions about the UTR PTT?
settings.row_content: Find more FAQs on the UTR Pro Tennis Tour page here. Didn't find your question there? Email ptt@utrsports.com.

settings.heading: Watch: What is the UTR Pro Tennis Tour?

settings.description: [PTT Tour Card] is a great strategy… It motivates players to participate more, it attracts better players, it creates almost like a whole separate tour-like environment.
settings.author: Veronika Miroshnichenko

settings.description: The PTT Tour Card is a great way for up-and-coming players to improve their match skills. Playing matches against similar UTRs and above will make their games skyrocket!
settings.author: Maya Joint
settings.author-designation: Top 100 WTA Player, Reached R2 at 2024 US Open

settings.description: The PTT Tour Card will be a game-changer for player development. It’ll push players to keep improving, knowing there’s real financial support behind them every step of the way.
settings.author: Adam Walton
settings.author-designation: Two-time PTT champion, Top 100 ATP player

settings.description: The PTT Tour Card will be an incredible way to elevate players’ development. It will provide opportunities for improvement and support throughout their tennis journey!
settings.author: Fiona Crawley
settings.author-designation: Former No. 1 Women's College Tennis Player, Rising Pro
